comments.author: kozzi11@gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20110321 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: 

Some images have bad color (violet instead blue)

I find this bug only on GNU/Linux version of Firefox, on windows version its seems OK.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. go to for eg. http://www.abclinuxu.cz/blog/Untitled/2011/3/comix-kernel-ultras-scitani-2011#6
2. Look at the avatar (KDE logo) on the right side
3. thats all
Actual Results:  
color of this image is wrong (violet)

Expected Results:  
blue color :)
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20110321 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: 

Some images have bad color (violet instead blue)

I find this bug only on GNU/Linux version of Firefox, on windows version its seems OK.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. go to for eg. http://www.abclinuxu.cz/blog/Untitled/2011/3/comix-kernel-ultras-scitani-2011#6
2. Look at the avatar (KDE logo) on the right side
3. thats all
Actual Results:  
color of this image is wrong (violet)

Expected Results:  
blue color :)
comments.creator: kozzi11@gmail.com
bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.text: What happens if you set the "gfx.color_management.mode" preference to 0 (from its default value of 2)?
comments.raw_text: What happens if you set the "gfx.color_management.mode" preference to 0 (from its default value of 2)?
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu
bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.creator: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.raw_text: Jeff?  Is Daniel's system using the wrong gamma, or are we doing something wrong in color management?
comments.text: Jeff?  Is Daniel's system using the wrong gamma, or are we doing something wrong in color management?

comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.raw_text: Daniel, note that "0" turns off color management, so you probably don't want to leave it like that in general.
comments.text: Daniel, note that "0" turns off color management, so you probably don't want to leave it like that in general.
comments.creator: bzbarsky@mit.edu

comments.author: ryanli@ryanli.org
comments.creator: ryanli@ryanli.org
comments.text:
I confirm this behaviour, and turning off gfx.color_management.mode helped me solved the issue.
For what it's worth, I run Firefox 4 on Gentoo with fglrx.
comments.raw_text:
I confirm this behaviour, and turning off gfx.color_management.mode helped me solved the issue.
For what it's worth, I run Firefox 4 on Gentoo with fglrx.
